text: Generallöjtnant (Lieutenant General) Lars-Erik Englund (23 March 1934 – 19 October 2010) was a Swedish Air Force officer. His senior appointments included military commander of the Upper Norrland Military District (Milo ÖN) from 1986 to 1988 and Chief of the Air Force/Chief of Air Force Command from 1988 to 1994. ==Personal life== In 1954, Englund married Gunn Wendel (died in 1981). He married a second time in 1986 with Birgitta Mårdstam (born 1940). He had three children. ==Dates of rank== *19?? – Fänrik (Second lieutenant) *19?? – Löjtnant (Lieutenant) *19?? – Kapten (Captain) *1971 – Major *1972 – Överstelöjtnant (Lieutenant colonel) *1979 – Överste (Colonel) *1983 – Major general *1986 – Generallöjtnant (Lieutenant general) ==Awards and decorations== * Commander of the Legion of Merit (November 1992) * Commander of the National Order of Merit (1992) * Commander 1st Class of the Order of the White Rose of Finland (1992) * Swedish Air Force Volunteers Association Medal of Merit in gold (1994) * Swedish Air Force Volunteers Association Medal of Merit in silver (1991) ==Bibliography== * ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2010 deaths Category:People with ankylosing spondylitis
title: Lars-Erik Englund
